isis.stitle: GENERAL INSTRUMENT ELECTRONIC PROGRAMMABLE SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER - REMOVE AND INSTALL - SPEEDOMETER AND TACHOMETER SENSOR

note.para: Vehicles with electronic engine controller (CELECT, PEEC, CAT 3176 or with PT PACER) will have a dual coil speedometer sensor with (2) pair of leads instead of one pair. Identify leads before disconnecting. The coil and lead used by the speedometer will have 900-1100 ohms resistance and the coil used by the engine ECM will have 1200-1450 ohms resistance. If the leads are reversed the units will function properly. Vehicle speedometer circuits will include circuit 47. Electronic engine or cruise circuits will be circuit 97.
A single coil sensor for the speedometer or tachometer will have 600-700 ohms resistance.

step1.para: Disconnect sensor lead from vehicle harness.
Loosen sensor lock nut and remove sensor from flywheel housing or rear of transmission ( Figure 6 or Figure 7).

figure.caption: Engine Speed Sensor Installation and Adjustment

caution.para: Turn key switch to off position before installing sensor.

step1.para: Turn sensor in until the sensor bottoms out against the engine flywheel (tachometer sensor) or transmission gear (speedometer sensor). Back out (1) full turn.

note.para: When re-installing a sensor be sure remove any foreign material from the sensor. The sensor is magnetic and the presence of metal debris could weaken the voltage output.

step1.para:
Tighten sensor lock nut using wrench to prevent sensor from turning while tightening lock nut. Tighten lock nut to specifications (refer to
SPECIFICATIONS).
Connect sensor lead to vehicle harness connector.
Run engine to test tachometer or road/dynamometer test to check speedometer.
